TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class Class : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.IO.ISerializable, Java.Lang.Reflect.IGenericDeclaration, Java.Lang.Reflect.IType

.class public auto ansi sealed Class extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ISerializable, class Java.Lang.Reflect.IGenericDeclaration, class Java.Lang.Reflect.IType, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The in-memory representation of a Java class.

remarks.para:
The in-memory representation of a Java class. This representation serves as the starting point for querying class-related information, a process usually called "reflection". There are basically three types of Class instances: those representing real classes and interfaces, those representing primitive types, and those representing array classes.
Class instances representing object types (classes or interfaces)

These represent an ordinary class or interface as found in the class hierarchy. The name associated with these Class instances is simply the fully qualified class name of the class or interface that it represents. In addition to this human-readable name, each class is also associated by a so-called descriptor, which is the letter "L", followed by the class name and a semicolon (";"). The descriptor is what the runtime system uses internally for identifying the class (for example in a DEX file).

These represent the standard Java primitive types and hence share their names (for example "int" for the int primitive type). Although it is not possible to create new instances based on these Class instances, they are still useful for providing reflection information, and as the component type of array classes. There is one Class instance for each primitive type, and their descriptors are:

item.term: B representing the byte primitive type
S representing the short primitive type
I representing the int primitive type
J representing the long primitive type
F representing the float primitive type
D representing the double primitive type
C representing the char primitive type
Z representing the boolean primitive type
V representing void function return values

remarks.para: These represent the classes of Java arrays. There is one such Class instance per combination of array leaf component type and arity (number of dimensions). In this case, the name associated with the Class consists of one or more left square brackets (one per dimension in the array) followed by the descriptor of the class representing the leaf component type, which can be either an object type or a primitive type. The descriptor of a Class representing an array type is the same as its name. Examples of array class descriptors are:

Returns the canonical name of this class.

remarks.para: Returns the canonical name of this class. If this class does not have a canonical name as defined in the Java Language Specification, then the method returns null.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Lang.Object Cast(class Java.Lang.Object obj) cil managed

Docs.summary: Casts the given object to the type represented by this Class.

remarks.para: Casts the given object to the type represented by this Class. If the object is null then the result is also null.

Docs.exception: if the object cannot be cast to the given type.

Docs.summary: To be added.
Returns the class loader which was used to load the class represented by this Class.

remarks.para: Returns the class loader which was used to load the class represented by this Class. Implementations are free to return null for classes that were loaded by the bootstrap class loader. The Android reference implementation, though, always returns a reference to an actual class loader.

Docs.summary: Returns a Class object which represents the component type if this class represents an array type.

remarks.para: Returns a Class object which represents the component type if this class represents an array type. Returns null if this class does not represent an array type. The component type of an array type is the type of the elements of the array.

Docs.summary: Returns the class that this class is a member of, or null if this class is a top-level class, a primitive, an array, or defined within a method or constructor.

remarks.para: Returns the class that this class is a member of, or null if this class is a top-level class, a primitive, an array, or defined within a method or constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool DesiredAssertionStatus() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the assertion status for the class represented by this Class.

remarks.para: Returns the assertion status for the class represented by this Class. Assertion is enabled / disabled based on the class loader, package or class default at runtime.

Docs.summary: Returns the class enclosing this class.

remarks.para: Returns the class enclosing this class. For most classes this is the same as the . For classes defined within a method or constructor (typically anonymous inner classes), this is the declaring class of that member.

Docs.summary: Returns the enclosing Constructor of this Class, if it is an anonymous or local/automatic class; otherwise null.

remarks.para: Returns the enclosing Constructor of this Class, if it is an anonymous or local/automatic class; otherwise null.

Docs.summary: Returns the enclosing Method of this Class, if it is an anonymous or local/automatic class; otherwise null.

remarks.para: Returns the enclosing Method of this Class, if it is an anonymous or local/automatic class; otherwise null.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Class ForName(string className) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a Class object which represents the class with the given name.

remarks.para: Returns a Class object which represents the class with the given name. The name should be the name of a non-primitive class, as described in the . Primitive types can not be found using this method; use int.class or Integer.TYPE instead.

If the class has not yet been loaded, it is loaded and initialized first. This is done through either the class loader of the calling class or one of its parent class loaders. It is possible that a static initializer is run as a result of this call.

Docs.exception: if the requested class cannot be found.
if an error occurs during linkage
if an exception occurs during static initialization of a class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Lang.Class ForName (string className, bool initializeBoolean, Java.Lang.ClassLoader classLoader);
.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Class ForName(string className, bool initializeBoolean, class Java.Lang.ClassLoader classLoader) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a Class object which represents the class with the given name.

remarks.para: Returns a Class object which represents the class with the given name. The name should be the name of a non-primitive class, as described in the . Primitive types can not be found using this method; use int.class or Integer.TYPE instead.
If the class has not yet been loaded, it is loaded first, using the given class loader. If the class has not yet been initialized and shouldInitialize is true, the class will be initialized.

Docs.exception: if the requested class cannot be found.
if an error occurs during linkage
if an exception occurs during static initialization of a class.

Docs.summary: Returns an array containing all the annotations of this class.

remarks.para: Returns an array containing all the annotations of this class. If there are no annotations then an empty array is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Lang.Class[] GetClasses() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array containing Class objects for all public classes, interfaces, enums and annotations that are members of this class and its superclasses.

remarks.para: Returns an array containing Class objects for all public classes, interfaces, enums and annotations that are members of this class and its superclasses. This does not include classes of implemented interfaces. If there are no such class members or if this object represents a primitive type then an array of length 0 is returned.

Docs.summary: Returns an array containing Constructor objects for all public constructors for this Class.

remarks.para: Returns an array containing Constructor objects for all public constructors for this Class. If there are no public constructors or if this Class represents an array class, a primitive type or void then an empty array is returned.

Docs.summary: Returns the annotations that are directly defined on the class represented by this Class.

remarks.para: Returns the annotations that are directly defined on the class represented by this Class. Annotations that are inherited are not included in the result. If there are no annotations at all, an empty array is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Lang.Reflect.Field GetField(string name) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a Field object which represents the public field with the given name.

remarks.para: Returns a Field object which represents the public field with the given name. This method first searches the class C represented by this Class, then the interfaces implemented by C and finally the superclasses of C.

Docs.exception: if the field cannot be found.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Lang.Reflect.Field[] GetFields() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array containing Field objects for all public fields for the class C represented by this Class.

remarks.para: Returns an array containing Field objects for all public fields for the class C represented by this Class. Fields may be declared in C, the interfaces it implements or in the superclasses of C. The elements in the returned array are in no particular order.
If there are no public fields or if this class represents an array class, a primitive type or void then an empty array is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Lang.Reflect.IType[] GetGenericInterfaces() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the s of the interfaces that this Class directly implements.

remarks.para: Returns the s of the interfaces that this Class directly implements. If the Class represents a primitive type or void then an empty array is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Lang.Class[] GetInterfaces() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array of Class objects that match the interfaces in the implements declaration of the class represented by this Class.

remarks.para: Returns an array of Class objects that match the interfaces in the implements declaration of the class represented by this Class. The order of the elements in the array is identical to the order in the original class declaration. If the class does not implement any interfaces, an empty array is returned.
This method only returns directly-implemented interfaces, and does not include interfaces implemented by superclasses or superinterfaces of any implemented interfaces.

Docs.summary: Returns an array containing Method objects for all public methods for the class C represented by this Class.

remarks.para: Returns an array containing Method objects for all public methods for the class C represented by this Class. Methods may be declared in C, the interfaces it implements or in the superclasses of C. The elements in the returned array are in no particular order.
If there are no public methods or if this Class represents a primitive type or void then an empty array is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Net.URL GetResource(string resName) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the URL of the given resource, or null if the resource is not found.

remarks.para: Returns the URL of the given resource, or null if the resource is not found. The mapping between the resource name and the URL is managed by the class' class loader.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Stream GetResourceAsStream(string resName) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a read-only stream for the contents of the given resource, or null if the resource is not found.

remarks.para: Returns a read-only stream for the contents of the given resource, or null if the resource is not found. The mapping between the resource name and the stream is managed by the class' class loader.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Lang.Object[] GetSigners() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns null.

remarks.para: Returns null. (On Android, a ClassLoader can load classes from multiple dex files. All classes from any given dex file will have the same signers, but different dex files may have different signers. This does not fit well with the original ClassLoader-based model of getSigners.)

Docs.summary: Returns an integer that represents the modifiers of the class represented by this Class.

remarks.para: Returns an integer that represents the modifiers of the class represented by this Class. The returned value is a combination of bits defined by constants in the class.

Docs.summary: Returns the name of the class represented by this Class.

remarks.para: Returns the name of the class represented by this Class. For a description of the format which is used, see the class definition of .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Lang.Object NewInstance() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a new instance of the class represented by this Class, created by invoking the default (that is, zero-argument) constructor.

remarks.para: Returns a new instance of the class represented by this Class, created by invoking the default (that is, zero-argument) constructor. If there is no such constructor, or if the creation fails (either because of a lack of available memory or because an exception is thrown by the constructor), an InstantiationException is thrown. If the default constructor exists but is not accessible from the context where this method is invoked, an IllegalAccessException is thrown.

Docs.exception: if the default constructor is not visible.
if the instance cannot be created.

Returns the Package of which the class represented by this Class is a member.

remarks.para: Returns the Package of which the class represented by this Class is a member. Returns null if no Package object was created by the class loader of the class.

Docs.summary: Returns null.

remarks.para: Returns null.

Docs.summary: Returns the simple name of the class represented by this Class as defined in the source code.

remarks.para: Returns the simple name of the class represented by this Class as defined in the source code. If there is no name (that is, the class is anonymous) then an empty string is returned. If the receiver is an array then the name of the underlying type with square braces appended (for example "Integer[]") is returned.

Docs.summary: To be added.
Returns the Class object which represents the superclass of the class represented by this Class.

remarks.para: Returns the Class object which represents the superclass of the class represented by this Class. If this Class represents the Object class, a primitive type, an interface or void then the method returns null. If this Class represents an array class then the Object class is returned.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
